intro: Gouania efatensis, commonly known as the Efaté Mountain Gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Efate in Vanuatu. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the understorey of tropical forests. Gouania efatensis is notable for its potential medicinal properties and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
